actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to provide that an alien must have resided in the United States continuously for at least 36 months in order to qualify for aid to families with dependent children, supplemental security income benefits, medicaid benefits, or aid or assistance under any other Federal or federally financed welfare program.

summary.text: Provides, under the Social Security Act, that an alien must have resided in the United States continuously for at least 36 months in order to qualify for aid to families with dependent children, supplemental security income benefits, medicaid benefits, or aid or assistance under any other Federal or federally financed welfare program.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to provide that an alien must have resided in the United States continuously for at least 36 months in order to qualify for aid to families with dependent children, supplemental security income benefits, medicaid benefits, or aid or assistance under any other Federal or federally financed welfare program.
